item.title: Australian PGA Championships round one cut short by storms, with Spain's Sebastian Garcia in the lead
item.description: In-form Spaniard Sebastian Garcia shoots three strokes clear of a big-name leaderboard before Brisbane's storms halt his first-round charge.

item.title: Mental health defence flagged in trial of son accused of killing father with a crowbar
item.description: A NSW court is told heard Milenko Snjegota had limited capacity for reason when he allegedly murdered his 74-year-old father in their home near Wollongong.

item.title: Dead fish, foam seen on metro beaches despite overall low Karenia algal levels
item.description: Authorities say metropolitan testing shows Karenia algal levels remain low compared with last month, despite thick foam and fish deaths seen on some beaches in recent days.

item.title: With a deal on Australia's environmental laws, Murray Watt has cemented his reputation as a 'fixer'
item.description: In his deal with the Greens, Environment Minister Murray Watt has just scraped off one of the biggest barnacles clinging to parliament.

item.title: Former Townsville mayor lied about his military service, health issues and education, watchdog finds
item.description: The Queensland Crime and Corruption Commission finds no evidence to back Troy Thompson's claims that he served in the SAS, had cancer and epilepsy, and two university degrees.

item.title: Woman sentenced over Willetton hit-and-run crash that injured schoolgirl Alexis Lloyd
item.description: A 49-year-old L-plater who kept driving after hitting a 12-year-old as she walked to school in suburban Perth, causing serious injuries, is jailed for 16 months.

item.title: Neuropsychologist in 'emphatic' disagreement over whether alleged murderer had substantial mental impairment
item.description: A neuropsychologist tells the court an NT man accused of murdering an international student was not suffering from a substantial mental impairment at the time of the alleged crime.

item.title: Cameron Reginald Welsh handed extra jail time for bashing prison guards
item.description: A NSW inmate who bashed four prison guards will serve extra jail time, after a judge quashed his non-custodial term on appeal, calling it "an affront to the administration of justice".

item.title: Thursday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Hong Kong fire kills at least 83, hundreds still missing as firefighters continue to battle blaze
item.description: Authorities say the apartment complex blaze may have been caused by a "grossly negligent" construction firm using unsafe materials. Three men have been arrested on suspicion of manslaughter.

item.title: Correspondent James Oaten in Hong Kong
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Student paramedic wins battle with Ambulance Victoria over beard policy
item.description: A student paramedic who accused Ambulance Victoria of discrimination on the grounds of race and religion is "ecstatic" to have won his battle to allow cultural beards on the job.

item.title: Patrick Lee Brown sentenced to three years in prison over 'inexcusable' Tasmanian car chases
item.description: During sentencing, a Supreme Court Justice told Patrick Lee Brown he "completely disregarded the safety of anyone else" during two different police pursuits, including one in a stolen rental truck with blown-out tyres.

item.title: Frozen rewrote the Disney princess narrative — and 12 years later, it's still relevant
item.description: It wasn't just a box office success — Frozen introduced a new type of Disney princess: one who was strong, flawed and uninterested in romance.

item.title: Hong Kong residents devastated by mega blaze engulfing blocks of flats in Tai Po district
item.description: Locals are in shock after fire destroyed apartment blocks home to thousands of people, as questions remain about the suitability of building materials and a lack of fire alarms.

item.title: Social media ban implementation will 'vary' across platforms, eSafety commissioner warns
item.description: Not all Australians aged under 16 will "magically disappear overnight" from social media, the nation's online safety regulator says, amid a legal challenge to pause the start of the federal government's ban.

item.title: The flashpoints leading the US and Venezuela to the brink of a conflict decades in the making
item.description: Tensions between Donald Trump and Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro Moros have been escalating after months of launching lethal air strikes on vessels accused of shipping deadly drugs north to the US.

item.title: Calls for states to change alcohol laws ahead of women’s ministers meeting
item.description: A major review into preventing violence against women and children called for changes to immediate alcohol home delivery

item.title: Second storm of the year pushes tiny town of Nevertire to its limit
item.description: A storm that hit a tiny rural NSW town, damaging one in 10 homes, is psychologically draining for residents.

item.title: Perth Scorchers defeat Melbourne Renegades by four wickets in WBBL clash at Junction Oval
item.description: Perth have survived a dramatic collapse to beat the Melbourne Renegades by four wickets, denying the Renegades a share of top spot on the WBBL ladder.

item.title: One of Hong Kong's deadliest fires engulfed multiple high-rise towers in just hours
item.description: Hong Kong's deadliest fire in decades tore through a group of high-rise residential towers in a densely packed housing estate, causing major issues for firefighters. This is how the catastrophe unfolded.

item.title: Greens out-step flat-footed Liberals on crucial environmental deal
item.description: The environmental deal is a major win for a government whose critics on the left are calling for it to be more reformist.

item.title: Oscar Piastri dismisses helping McLaren teammate Lando Norris win F1 drivers' championship
item.description: Oscar Piastri says McLaren raised the prospect of the Australian helping his teammate Lando Norris win the Formula 1 world championship, but it was rejected.

item.title: Infrastructure installed to probe Coorong storm surges and groundwater impacts
item.description: Infrastructure to monitor the impact of rising sea levels and storm surges on the Coorong in South Australia has been installed along the thin strip of coastline between Goolwa Beach and the lagoons of the Ramsar-listed wetland.

item.title: Police arrest more people over violence at Melbourne CBD rally in October
item.description: Two men have been charged with assaulting police at a rally in Melbourne's CBD in October. The arrests come as police prepare for another demonstration in the city on Sunday.

item.title: Federal politics: PM declares Labor-Greens deal a 'yesalition' as environment bill passes — as it happened
item.description: The federal government's overhauled national environment laws have passed parliament.

item.title: Cool weather sets cherry crops 'weeks' behind schedule in lead-up to Christmas
item.description: The latest casualty in a year of delayed crops is the cherry, with cold weather in some growing regions setting the festive favourite "weeks" behind schedule.

item.title: Hong Kong residents react to deadly apartment block fire
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Indian cricket star Deepti Sharma fetches highest WPL price, Australia captain Alyssa Healy unsold
item.description: All-rounder Deepti Sharma fetched the highest price at the Women's Premier League (WPL) auction, while Australia captain Alyssa Healy, one of the marquee players up for grabs, went unsold.

item.title: How a breakdown in the search for a boat named Margaret led to adventure on the Birdsville Track
item.description: The ABC's Landline crew discovers extreme kindness with a can-do attitude after a mechanical breakdown in South Australia's outback.

item.title: Former WA police officer Kaine Burgess relives the night his patrol car was rammed
item.description: More than two years on from a serious crash that saw him medically retired, a former police officer says he can still hear the screech of tyres before the deafening bang of a car slamming into his police wagon.

item.title: 'Brumby Bill' protecting heritage value of wild horses to be scrapped in NSW
item.description: A widely criticised bill recognising the heritage value of wild horses in Kosciuszko National Park will be scrapped in a move celebrated by the Invasive Species Council.

item.title: Estella brings strength and resilience to her family as she navigates life with disability in remote NT
item.description: Nineteen-year-old Estella Jones lives with a disability in her hometown of Tennant Creek, where she loves baking brownies, singing karaoke and spending time with good friends.

item.title: Fuzzy Zoeller, Masters and US Open champion, dies aged 74
item.description: Fuzzy Zoeller, a two-time major champion and one of golf's most gregarious characters whose career was tainted by a racially insensitive joke about Tiger Woods, has died aged 74.

item.title: Traditional owners in WA's north challenge state over fast-tracking mining exploration approvals
item.description: Traditional owners in WA's north launch legal action against the state government claiming it is fast-tracking mining and exploration projects using "expedited procedure" approvals at cultural expense.

item.title: Inquest concludes into death of SA boatie Tony Higgins
item.description: A coroner has found Anthony Higgins, who went missing in 2020 sparking the largest and most expensive marine search in South Australian waters, died two weeks later when he went missing again.

item.title: Common antidepressant helps reduce some men's domestic violence, ReINVEST trial finds
item.description: The findings are significant not just because of how much the trial reduced domestic violence, but because only a few years ago it drew fierce criticism from women's advocates and politicians.

item.title: Benedict Bryant found guilty of dangerous driving causing the death of Jai Kalani Wright
item.description: Benedict Bryant had pleaded not guilty to dangerous driving occasioning death over the crash in inner Sydney in February 2022, which killed Jai Wright.

item.title: Christmas prawns could be more expensive as wild-caught Australian seafood stocks drop off
item.description: Wild-caught Aussie prawn fishers are reporting a tough catch season. Here's what you need to know.

item.title: Award-winning regional pharmacist says relationship with patients is 'unique'
item.description: A north-west Victorian pharmacist is being celebrated for his contribution to his local community after winning an award for going the "extra mile".

item.title: Super Netball could grow to 10 teams as Netball Australia invites licence bids
item.description: Super Netball could have two additional teams by 2027, with Netball Australia calling for expressions of interest to expand the competition.

item.title: What time is the 2025 AFLW grand final? All you need to know as Brisbane and North Melbourne clash
item.description: Wondering what time the AFLW grand final starts and how you can watch it live? We've got you covered.

item.title: Rare West Australian seaweed scrapbooks provide glimpse into history
item.description: The State Library of WA is running an appeal to save a set of seaweed scrapbooks made nearly 100 years ago by a renowned Kalgoorlie-born naturalist.

item.title: Hong Kong building fire prompts serious questions about construction safety
item.description: Just months ago, Hong Kong leaders were dismissing calls for a total ban on bamboo scaffolding on construction sites. Now they are facing one of the region's worst building-fire catastrophes, and anger is growing.

item.title: Why the banking regulator is targeting property investors
item.description: It's been called a bubble for more than 15 years but the great Aussie housing price boom has barely skipped a beat, as regulators eye the threat of risky loans.

item.title: Victorian regulator imposes conditions on Monash IVF after embryo bungles
item.description: Monash IVF has been ordered to be more rigorous when checking the biological origin of embryos to avoid more mix-ups, in order to stay registered in Victoria.

item.title: Jane Edmanson hangs up her Gardening Australia hat, reflects on labour of love behind show's success
item.description: As Gardening Australia's longest-serving presenter, Jane Edmanson says farewell and shares the secrets behind the success of Australia’s favourite gardening program.

item.title: French prisoners escape jail using saw and bedsheets
item.description: The fugitives broke out of the prison in the eastern city of Dijon in the early hours of Thrusday, local time, and 100 police officers are on their trail.

item.title: Crime scenes declared in Mackay as search continues for Wayne Pedro Morseu
item.description: Wayne Pedro Morseu was reported missing on November 10, with police now upgrading his disappearance to suspicious.

item.title: F1 Qatar start time, how to watch grand prix, and drivers' championship standings
item.description: Lando Norris has match point heading into the penultimate weekend of the Formula 1 season, with the British driver having one hand on a maiden drivers' championship.

item.title: Doctors and nurses claim ramping protocol gives ambulance patients priority access to ED, but paramedics disagree
item.description: Medical experts fear sick or injured Tasmanians who make their own way to emergency departments wait longer than others, due to pressures to fast-track ambulance patients.

item.title: Dairy 'disrupter' wins science award for inventing spreadable butter in 1970s
item.description: An 86-year-old farmer claims this year's Dairy Science Award for inventing spreadable butter, by mixing oils with cultured cream at a time when it was illegal.

item.title: Third renewable energy company discovers asbestos in wind farm turbine lifts
item.description: An anti-asbestos advocate wants a review of import supply chains after a third renewable energy company confirmed the discovery of asbestos in wind farm turbine lifts.

item.title: Australia names unchanged squad for second Ashes Test, with captain Pat Cummins still out
item.description: Australia will go into the second Ashes Test against England in Brisbane next week with an unchanged line-up, meaning there is no place for captain Pat Cummins.

item.title: Hundred of prison staff ride from Sydney to Goulburn to honour mates who have died
item.description: A man whose correctional officer wife was "fair dinkum about helping people" leads more than 300 prison staff on a ride honouring the lives of colleagues who have died in New South Wales.

item.title: Tasmania's education department and RSB Travel charged over child's attempt to drink engine coolant
item.description: Tasmania's education department and a bus company have both appeared in court after a child with a disability was allegedly left unattended on a bus with access to a bottle of engine coolant in a plastic water bottle.

item.title: Corporate Travel Management embroiled in overcharging scandal potentially worth more than $100 million
item.description: Corporate Travel Management helps arrange travel bookings for clients ranging from Wesfarmers to the Australian government.

item.title: Whadjuk Aboriginal Corporation to oversee Rottnest Island cultural services
item.description: A strife-torn Aboriginal corporation crucial to heritage approvals across Perth wins a contract to oversee cultural services on Rottnest Island, Wadjemup, one of Western Australia's premier tourism destinations.

item.title: Kangaroos coach Darren Crocker opens up on difficult Mia King selection call ahead of AFLW grand final
item.description: North Melbourne coach Darren Crocker says telling Mia King she isn't going to play in the AFLW grand final is "one of the harder conversations" he's had to have.

item.title: Victims' families of Westfield Bondi Junction attack grateful for inquest but want 'reforms'
item.description: A lawyer representing one of the bereaved families took aim at the owner and operator of Westfield, saying they were "extremely disappointed".

item.title: A crystal Fabergé egg is expected to sell for more than $40 million
item.description: A rare crystal and diamond Fabergé egg is heading to auction with a price estimate of more than $40 million.

item.title: Preparing my garden for time away in summer
item.description: Leaving my garden in the heat of summer can feel worrying but some simple planning means it misses me less than I miss it.

item.title: Struggling AFLW teams GWS, Collingwood and Gold Coast receive extra picks or list spots from league
item.description: Three of the AFLW's worst-performing clubs will receive boosts to their lists, with the help announced the day before the grand final.

item.title: Lotterywest cancels licences of seven stores across Perth found to be selling illegal tobacco or vapes
item.description: Seven stores across Perth found to be selling illegal tobacco and vapes have their lotteries licences terminated, as attempts to disrupt the illicit and growing trade continues.

item.title: Kyra Cooney-Cross scores stunning long range goal as Matildas down New Zealand 5-0
item.description: A spectacular long range effort from Kyra Cooney-Cross has helped the Matildas to a dominant 5-0 win over New Zealand in Australia's penultimate game before hosting the Asian Cup in March.

item.title: Hong Kong's aging towers face urgent questions after city's deadliest blaze in decades
item.description: Hong Kong's worst fire in decades exposed long-standing weaknesses in its aging residential blocks. The question haunting the city is whether the disaster could happen again.

item.title: One of seven Rosenberg's goannas from ACT reserve is missing from home for second time in two years
item.description: One of a handful of Rosenberg’s goannas living in the ACT’s hill reserves has once again wandered off, prompting calls from a local conservation organisation for help bringing him back.

item.title: Brodie Kostecki wins Supercars grand final sprint race as Chad Mostert narrows gap to leader Broc Feeney
item.description: Brodie Kostecki prevails in wet and wild conditions to win the opening Supercars grand final race, as Chaz Mostert closes in on the championship lead.

item.title: Wala Kooral-bi juvenile justice facility opens in northern WA
item.description: An on-country youth diversion facility has been built in the state's far north, offering a culturally grounded alternative to traditional youth justice programs.

item.title: Confidence remains in WA iron ore industry despite forecast royalty drop
item.description: Western Australia has long prospered off its hefty irone ore mining royalties, but new figures reveal that revenue may drop by billions.

item.title: Qantas terminal at Melbourne Airport evacuated and flights delayed due to fire
item.description: The Qantas terminal is re-opening after being evacuated because of a small fire inside Melbourne Airport.

item.title: NT parliament hears claims of children in youth detention being transferred without families' knowledge
item.description: Two politicians allege NT children in youth detention are being moved from Alice Springs to Darwin without their families' knowledge.

item.title: ICC rejects plea to release Philippine ex-president Rodrigo Duterte
item.description: The judge says it is "necessary" for the 80-year-old to remain in detention as the conditions proposed by his lawyers do not meet the conditions for parole.

item.title: Eight arrested and 128 people dead as alarm faults confirmed in Hong Kong fire
item.description: The arrests come as the probe into what caused the deadly blaze that killed at least 128 people continues.

item.title: Imran Khan's son and political allies concerned about his health amid block on prison visits
item.description: The family and political allies of Pakistan's former prime minister say they've not been allowed to visit him in prison for weeks but authorities say he is well.

item.title: Putin may laugh but Europe is taking Russian aggression seriously
item.description: Something has now been unleashed in Europe which is going to be hard to put back in the bottle.

item.title: Albanese knows the power dynamic between Labor and mining interests has shifted
item.description: There has been a shift in the power dynamic between Labor and the mining industry. This week's environmental law reform is its embodiment.

item.title: John 'Wacka' Williams labels Barnaby Joyce's resignation an 'act of treason'
item.description: The MP's resignation from the Nationals surprised no one, but drew ire from members of the party. Those on the ground in his electorate have a more mixed view.

item.title: Director Peter Weir on capturing the mood for Picnic at Hanging Rock
item.description: Renowned Australian director Peter Weir gives a rare behind-the-scenes insight into what made Picnic at Hanging Rock such a memorable and enduring film.

item.title: Cape Barren Island was returned for Aboriginal self-governance 20 years ago
item.description: Twenty years ago, Cape Barren Island was handed back to its traditional owners. Today's children are proof of the life-changing power of that act.

item.title: Hong Kong tower residents had safety complaints more than 12 months before deadly fires
item.description: Many of the people who managed to escape the Wang Fuk Court fires in Hong Kong believe the disaster could have been prevented, saying they had flagged safety concerns more than a year ago.

item.title: Normalisation of location sharing, tech-facilitated abuse in spotlight after Lilie James inquest
item.description: Experts on gendered violence have warned against the proliferation of everyday location sharing tools to control victim-survivors after NSW's top coroner found Paul Thijssen used them to track Lilie James before her murder.

item.title: King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard on quitting Spotify, orchestras, raves, and world domination
item.description: Their rock, rave and orchestral music attracts a cult global following. But the prolific, chaotic King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard are just "at peace with failing".

item.title: R360 launch postponed from 2026 to 2028, after players withdraw due to threats of NRL bans
item.description: Threats of long bans for prospective R360 players prompted "a handful" of them to withdraw from the rebel league, which now says it will launch in 2028 instead of next year.

item.title: Crowdy Bay shark attack highlights need for first aid devices, drone surveillance on remote beaches
item.description: A makeshift tourniquet may have made the difference between a shark attack on the NSW Mid North Coast this week claiming one life not two. The attack has put a spotlight on how fatalities may be prevented.

item.title: Australia's emissions have dropped, but we've got our work cut out to reach targets
item.description: Australia's emissions had the biggest drop ever this year outside the artificial kink in the curve during COVID-19 shutdowns, but there's still a lot of work to do.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Gus has been gone for 63 days, and searches of mines, dams and scrub have yielded no clues
item.description: The disappearance of Gus Lamont is one of those events that have a seismic impact on public consciousness: they distress, disturb, upset and unsettle. This week six mine shafts were searched, providing no further clues in the case.

item.title: Waukaringa mine ruins
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Google's global data hub plan for Christmas Island gets mixed reviews from locals
item.description: Google's plans for a data hub could drag this remote island from a digitally starved past into an AI-powered future. But are the locals ready?

item.title: Trolls stole Dr Juliet Turner's joy and in doing so took their own
item.description: The saddest aspect of all this that a generation of boys may feel compelled to suppress the ordinary the joy of celebrating another's success.

item.title: Adoption support service warns against increasing adoption in Queensland
item.description: Queensland should overhaul "outdated" adoption laws that sever children's legal ties to their families, while ensuring adoption remains a last resort, a peak support service tells a commission of inquiry.

item.title: Inquiry into male suicide rates hears migrants left feeling 'invisible, unheard and completely lost’ in Australia
item.description: Men make up more than 75 per cent of all suicide deaths in Australia, but Lifeline says they only make up about 40 per cent of helpline service users — and even when men do seek help they experienced "high levels of disengagement".

item.title: Unsettled weekend ahead in south-east Queensland, with 'pretty much nowhere' without chance of thunderstorms
item.description: A wet weekend is forecast for Australia's sunshine state, with meteorologists warning that "pretty much nowhere in Queensland" is without a chance of thunderstorms.

item.title: World-first tournament hopes to 'break down barriers' between the golf and disability communities
item.description: People with intellectual disabilities will have roles in planning, promoting, preparing, and supporting professionals at a charity golf tournament that is the first of its kind.

item.title: Sydney Thunder miss out on WBBL win as Adelaide Strikers clash ended early by rain
item.description: After rain falls for most of the Sydney Thunder's innings, umpires decide to call off their WBBL clash against the Strikers with Phoebe Litchfield one swing away from ending the game.

item.title: What would it be like to visit Hobart's proposed Macquarie Point stadium?
item.description: From potential gridlock to an "immersive" viewing experience, let's set aside the politics — just for a moment — and look at what planning documents tell us about the building at the heart of Tasmania's fiery stadium debate.

item.title: About 90 Jetstar flights cancelled due to global recall of Airbus A320 planes
item.description: About 90 Jetstar flights have been cancelled across Australia today due to a global recall of Airbus A320 planes for urgent software repairs.

item.title: Think you're ready to own a home? Here are the costs that experts want you to consider
item.description: We asked three financial experts about the up-front and ongoing costs of buying a home and for their tips on how to prepare for home ownership.

item.title: Cricket Australia set to speak with Usman Khawaja after he labelled Perth Ashes Test pitch a 'piece of shit'
item.description: Usman Khawaja may face a sanction for labelling the first Ashes Test surface a "piece of shit", with Cricket Australia understood to be disappointed by the remarks.

item.title: Survivors of forced adoption in South Australia call for greater recognition
item.description: Decades on from Australia's forced adoption era, just two states have set up a redress scheme for the mothers who were harmed. Survivors are calling for South Australia to take similar action — warning time is running out.

item.title: After suffering 'terrifying' postpartum rage, this mother wants others to know they're not alone
item.description: When Ali Gossage gave birth a second time, she did not experience the constant joys of motherhood. Instead, she was sometimes filled with "terrifying" anger.

item.title: Melbourne Airport terminal fire under investigation after evacuation of Qantas domestic terminal
item.description: A fire that forced the evacuation of Melbourne's Qantas domestic terminal on Friday night continues to be investigated.

item.title: Severe Tropical Cyclone Fina damage exposes need for new Royal Darwin Hospital
item.description: A new Royal Darwin Hospital would cost more than $1 billion to build, and likely take a decade or more to deliver. So who has the political bravery to commit?

item.title: Who's thriving and who's barely surviving in Australia, the Land of the Parrots?
item.description: Australia is the land of the parrot — few places in the world have such a dazzling array of colourful and clever members of the psittacine family.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Jetstar flight cancellations causes travel chaos for passengers at airports across Australia
item.description: The cancellation of Jetstar flights due to an issue with Airbus A320 planes has left passengers stranded across Australia.

item.title: 'Naughty Boy' pelican draws in visitors and locals in coastal tourist town of Kalbarri
item.description: Locals say this cheeky pelican has a personality unlike any bird they have ever seen.

item.title: Australia's peak music exam body under fire amid claims of 'slipping standards'
item.description: It is held up as the "gold standard" of music testing in the country, but there are claims the Australian Music Examinations Board is letting down talented students.

item.title: South-East Asia flood deaths rise as Cyclone Ditwah hits Sri Lanka, heads towards southern India
item.description: Parts of South-East Asia have been hit with record levels of rain as a cyclone hits Sri Lanka, causing floods and landslides, as the system heads towards India.

item.title: Snowy Mountains farmers call for support in managing spread of invasive weed African lovegrass
item.description: To the untrained eye, African lovegrass is just another plant in the NSW Snowy Mountains. But this golden plant is a deceptive invasive weed that is choking out the landscape, causing some farmers to leave the land.

item.title: Oscar Piastri fastest qualifier for Qatar F1 sprint race, with championship leader Lando Norris third
item.description: Oscar Piastri returns to form by qualifying fastest for the F1 sprint in Qatar, as he launches an unlikely bid to catch McLaren teammate and world championship leader Lando Norris.

item.title: Conservationists worldwide scrambling for alternative funding after USAID cuts
item.description: Citizen science and AI have never been more important to the environment after White House cuts to USAID are felt beneath the waves, a new report says.

item.title: Melbourne teen who died after nut allergy 'let down' by health system, family says
item.description: Four years after a 15-year-old boy died due to a nut allergy, a Victorian coroner is examining if the death was preventable and whether paramedics and doctors at the Box Hill Hospital provided appropriate care.

item.title: RBA could hike interest rates in early 2026 as banks rewrite forecasts
item.description: Hotter-than-expected inflation figures have caught most economists and policy makers off guard. The ongoing price pressures in the economy open the door for an RBA interest rate hike in 2026.

item.title: Skyhooks guitarist Bob Starkie dies aged 73 after a battle with cancer
item.description: A statement released on Skyhooks' official Facebook page announced his passing this morning.

item.title: Planning to bite into a sweet, juicy mango? Here's what to know about your favourite summer treat
item.description: What's the difference between a big R2E2, a delicate Honey Gold, and an iconic Kensington Pride? Find out before biting into a mango this season.

item.title: Victorian coroner determines Mount Buller hiker missing since 2019 is dead
item.description: A Coroner has determined that Niels Gunther Becker, 39, who went missing at Mount Buller in 2019 is dead but that no third party was involved.

item.title: Terminated Bedford staff in limbo, with millions of dollars owed in entitlements
item.description: Former Bedford staff have said they are owed millions of dollars in entitlements after they were made redundant when the disability employment provider entered voluntary administration earlier this year.

item.title: US halts all asylum claims following the shooting of two National Guard members in Washington DC

item.description: Icebox cakes are retro no-bake desserts made by layering store-bought biscuits and whipped cream. A no-fuss option for summer celebrations, this one can be assembled in 10 minutes and made well ahead of time.

item.description: Wondering what to read next? This month's best books include a novel that brings to life Britain's only named wind and a new book by the author of The Handmaid's Tale.

item.title: England captain Ben Stokes dismisses 'arrogant' label amid criticism of Ashes Test loss to Australia
item.description: Captain Ben Stokes responds to England's critics in the wake of the defeat to Australia in the first Test, maintaining his squad will not step back from its aggressive approach.

item.title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese marries Jodie Haydon at The Lodge in Canberra
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese marries his partner Jodie Haydon in a private ceremony at his official Canberra residence, after details of the wedding were kept top secret.

item.title: Anthony Albanese's wedding ends this 'killing season' with love's triumph
item.description: The two months preceding a wedding are notoriously hazardous. But consider the two months Anthony Albanese has just had.

item.title: Albanese and Haydon have wed in a ceremony that will go down in history
item.description: Anthony Albanese and Jodie Haydon can trace their relationship back five years, but the historic nature of their secretly planned wedding at The Lodge runs far deeper.

item.title: North Melbourne becomes first AFLW team to win consecutive premierships after clinical grand final showing
item.description: North Melbourne outclasses the Brisbane Lions by 40 points in the AFLW grand final to capture a history-making second consecutive premiership.

item.title: QLD Premier claims LNP victory in bitterly-contested Hinchinbrook by-election
item.description: The QLD Premier has declared a crushing LNP victory in a KAP stronghold, after a bitterly contested by-election campaign.

item.description: Supercars championship leader Broc Feeney overcomes engine dramas to take victory in the penultimate Adelaide grand final race.

item.title: WA set for scorching start to summer as state government launches new coastal CAT bus
item.description: WA capital is bracing for a 38C start to December, as the state government launches a free bus service to one of the city's most popular beaches.

item.title: Toni Lamond, known for her roles in Annie Get Your Gun and My Fair Lady, dies aged 93
item.description: Australian screen and stage actor Toni Lamond was known for her roles in Annie Get Your Gun, My Fair Lady, Number 96 and The Last Frontier.

item.title: Meg Lanning hits 73no as Stars down Renegades, Hurricanes defeat Scorchers
item.description: Former Australia captain Meg Lanning hits 73 not out to help the Stars to a convincing 45-run derby victory over the Renegades, while the Hurricanes down the Scorchers.

item.title: Kangaroos break new ground on the field and in the history books in AFLW flag defence
item.description: North Melbourne proves to be ground breakers and history makers as it extend its match-winning streak to 27 games in a comprehensive win over Brisbane.

item.title: Trump says airspace above and surrounding Venezuela to be closed in its entirety
item.description: US President Donald Trump says the entire airspace above the South American nation of Venezuela should be considered closed in its entirety.

item.title: As questions around horse welfare grow, equestrian sport is facing a reckoning
item.description: As questions around horse welfare grow, can equestrian sport's Olympic dream survive?

item.title: Why Barbados became a republic and cut ties with the British monarchy
item.description: With countries like Australia still debating whether or not the time has come to become a republic, what prompted tiny Barbados with its population of less than 300,000, to take the leap?

item.title: Hard Quiz: It's cute you think you can nail this quiz
item.description: I'm not going to stop you from trying, but it might be worth readjusting your expectations. Let's play, HARD!

item.title: Crypto gaming earns users tokens but also exposes them to risks of trading and speculation
item.description: As the crypto sector expands its appeal beyond tech insiders, the gamification of cryptocurrencies is appealing to younger users, which experts warn is walking the line between gaming and gambling.

item.title: Sex work influencers call out lack of transparency as young girls targeted by viral social media content
item.description: Sex workers say viral social media content, which often promotes a life of luxury, needs to be more transparent to avoid duping young followers.

item.title: Hobart stadium vote will determine future of historic Macquarie Point waterfront and AFL team
item.description: Since its inception, the stadium project has divided the Hobart community in a tug of war between development and preservation of its historic waterfront. In just days, the door will shut forever on one side of the debate.

item.title: The spooky First Nations movie you need to see at BIFF
item.description: First Nations stories are combined with modern horror scares in this new film from Australian creatives Chris Broadbent and Enzo Tedeschi.

item.title: Thai PM admits flood failures after trapped victims wait days for help
item.description: Thailand’s Health Ministry estimates that more than 160 people were killed in the disaster across nine provinces, but at least 110 of those died in Songkhla, where Hat Yai is the capital.

item.title: Oscar Piastri wins Qatar F1 sprint race, qualifies fastest for GP, edging closer to Lando Norris in standings
item.description: Australian driver Oscar Piastri is doing everything he can to catch McLaren teammate Lando Norris in the world championship race, winning the sprint race and qualifying in pole position for the Qatar Grand Prix.

item.title: Paul Kelly, Stella Donnelly, 5 Seconds of Summer lead November's best new albums
item.description: Sensitive song-smiths, reinvented boy bands, rock and rap upstarts — it's all here in an Ausmusic Month edition of the best new music.

item.title: 'Awareness gap' on mental health support available for new parents
item.description: Nilupulie Karunaratne thought asking for help was a sign of weakness. Then her husband referred her to a psychologist.

item.title: Labor should theoretically be confident ahead of the 2026 Victorian election — but challenges are mounting
item.description: On paper, Labor should be confident that it will score an unprecedented fourth term in office when Victorian voters go to the ballot box in a year's time, with the Liberal opposition still scrambling to present as an electable alternative.

item.title: One man's experience with homelessness reveals another side to Sydney's 2000 postcode
item.description: Sydney's 2000 postcode is associated with harbour views and flashiness, but Parker's seen a different side.

item.title: The Melbourne Metro Tunnel opens today. Here's what you need to know
item.description: It's the biggest upgrade to Melbourne's rail network in more than 40 years, and it's arrived — the long-awaited Metro Tunnel, along with its five new inner-city stations, opens to the public.

item.title: What people with diabetes want you to know
item.description: We spoke to six people with three different types of diabetes to find out what they wish more of the public knew. Here's what they had to say.

item.title: Marco Rubio, Steve Witkoff to meet Ukraine delegation in Florida, US official says
item.description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and special envoy Steve Witkoff will meet with Ukrainian negotiators in Florida for talks on a deal to end Russia's war in Ukraine, a senior US official says.

item.title: North Melbourne Kangaroos rally around injured Mia King after AFLW grand final
item.description: During their AFLW premiership celebrations, North Melbourne players make sure to take time for Mia King, who just missed the grand final with a knee injury.

item.title: Sterile flies rain down on Kangaroo Island as battle to wipe out sheep blowfly gets serious
item.description: Researchers on Kangaroo Island have been breeding and releasing millions of sterile Australian sheep blowflies in an attempt to eradicate the pest.

item.title: Chapter closes on 'The Family' murders that stole Adelaide's innocence
item.description: One of South Australia's most notorious murderers was this week rushed to an infirmary on the brink of death, prompting recollections of the time when young males disappeared across Adelaide in a set of gruesome crimes dubbed "The Family" murders. Warning: This story contains details some readers may find distressing.

item.title: British playwright and Oscar winner Tom Stoppard dies at 88
item.description: Stoppard was often hailed as the greatest British playwright of his generation, with multiple awards for his work on stage and screen.

item.title: Queensland to become first Australian jurisdiction to allow specialist general practitioners to diagnose ADHD in adults
item.description: Queensland is becoming the first jurisdiction in Australia to allow specialist GPs to diagnose ADHD in adults and prescribe treatment, but some hold concerns about the lack of mandatory specific training.

item.title: Australia's first Mormon arrived in Adelaide 185 years ago and immediately regretted it
item.description: It's been 185 years this month since Australia's first Mormon arrived in Adelaide. He immediately regretted the move.

item.title: Eli Katoa shares images post brain surgery, pays tribute to partner and hopes for NRL return
item.description: Melbourne Storm star Eli Katoa shares an update after his brain surgery, posting images of himself in hospital and saying he hopes to return to football "soon".

item.title: Indonesia flood death toll climbs amid cyclone devastation
item.description: Torrential rain causes flash floods and landslides in Indonesia, where the toll rises as authorities mount rescue operations.

item.title: Surfers set to pay to ride Fiji's world-class breaks after repeal of surf access law
item.description: Surfers wanting to catch a wave at Fiji's world class reef breaks could soon have to pay for the privilege after the repeal of a beach access law.

item.title: WA Legal Practice Board slammed by lawyers in scathing parliamentary submissions
item.description: In a scathing rebuke of their own watchdog, WA lawyers claim the state's Legal Practice Board is causing them psychological harm amid calls for urgent reform.

item.title: Jetstar flights resume across Australia after Airbus A320 software issue identified
item.description: The airline is warning further disruptions are possible after the issue sparked widespread delays across Australia on Saturday.

item.title: Energy independence? It would reduce the impact of global energy shocks
item.description: If Australia produced 100 per cent of its energy from renewable sources, it would reduce the impact of global energy shocks on Australia's economy.

item.title: Surfers Paradise sand 'island' to disappear by Christmas
item.description: Curious beachgoers are being cautioned to stay off the sandbar and to swim between the flags.

item.title: Coalition floats stronger 'values' test for migrants
item.description: Sussan Ley says migration tensions in Australia are not the fault of migrants, but a stronger "Australian values" test for those seeking to move here could form part of the Coalition's coming migration policy.

item.title: The Austrian heiress giving away her entire fortune
item.description: When Marlene Engelhorn inherited tens of millions of dollars from her grandma, she felt she had two choices: do something about it, or confirm she was "full of sh*t".

item.title: Sydney FC great Alex Brosque fumes over alleged handball in Wanderers' 1-0 ALM win
item.description: Sydney FC's four-match winning streak comes to a crashing halt, but its 1-0 loss to Western Sydney has sparked debate about what constitutes a handball.

item.title: Supporters of proposed Macquarie Point stadium rally ahead of crucial vote
item.description: Supporters of Tasmania's proposed AFL stadium have gathered on Hobart's parliament lawns on Sunday to show their backing of the controversial build.

item.title: Pilot dead after two light planes collide mid-air in Sydney's south-west
item.description: Emergency services were called to Napper Field, in Wedderburn about 11:50am on Sunday following reports of a crash.

item.title: Australian Border Force passport system outage causes delays nationwide
item.description: Long queues at international terminals have now cleared after a nationwide system outage affected all inbound and outbound passengers.

item.title: Ombudsman calls on NT government to urgently remove prisoners from police cells
item.description: The Northern Territory's prison watchdog has called on the government to urgently remove all inmates from police cells following an investigation which revealed prisoners sleeping between toilets and claims guards watched women showering.

item.title: Anthony Albanese and Jodie Haydon to honeymoon for five days after intimate Lodge wedding
item.description: Anthony Albanese and Jodie Haydon will head off on a five-day honeymoon tomorrow after an intimate wedding at The Lodge among only their closest family and friends.

item.title: 65yo diver drowns at Tank Cave near Mount Gambier
item.description: Police are investigating after a 65-year-old diver drowned at Tank Cave near Tantanoola in the state's south-east.

item.title: How the Kangaroos beat the Lions to claim back-to-back AFLW flags in their perfect season
item.description: Creating history by winning consecutive premierships and completing an unbeaten season is just reward for North Melbourne's boundary-pushing AFLW program.

item.title: Locals at Albanese's favourite pub respond to his wedding

item.title: New leader Jess Wilson to remain shadow treasurer under Victorian opposition reshuffle
item.description: New opposition leader Jess Wilson will retain shadow treasurer responsibilities under a reshuffle, while also keeping multiple former opposition leaders in the fold.

item.title: LNP's Wayde Chiesa promises to get to work after victory in Hinchinbrook by-election
item.description: The LNP's Wayde Chiesa will be the next representative for the Queensland seat of Hinchinbrook, which had been safely held by Katter's Australian Party since 2017.

item.title: Carbon dioxide import plan could see Darwin become world's climate pollution 'dumping ground', say activists
item.description: A plan for the Northern Territory to be among the first places in the world to import foreign carbon emissions has raised fears it will turn Darwin into a global pollution dumping ground.

item.title: Tasmania Police searching King Island for missing local teenager Lusian West
item.description: Local King Island teen Lusian West, 16, has not been seen since Friday, with Tasmania police and rescue crews to conduct aerial searches of the island's north.

item.title: Em Rusciano on finding balance in life after her ADHD and autism diagnoses
item.description: As a writer, singer, comedian, podcaster, author and single mum, Em Rusciano has become accustomed to navigating a chaotic life. The self-described "maximalist power queen" shares how she unwinds and how her approach to life has changed since going through perimenopause and being diagnosed with ADHD and autism.

item.title: Photographer Lyn Alcock captures wild antics of Dryandra's numbat population over 20 years
item.description: Lyn Alcock is known as the 'Numbat whisperer', spending hours every day observing and photographing the tiny, endangered marsupials, recording behaviours that have never been seen before.

item.title: Queensland Labor conference passes motion calling on Commonwealth to take CFMEU out of administration
item.description: A walkout was staged by members of the party's Right faction when the motion, which called for the Commonwealth to end the administration of the union, was moved.

item.title: Pope Leo visits the Blue Mosque in Istanbul during his first overseas trip as pontiff
item.description: Leo smiled during the 20-minute visit and joked with one of his guides, but did not appear to pray.

item.title: Anti-immigration protest met with counter-rally in Melbourne CBD
item.description: A large police presence, including riot police, was stationed across Melbourne's CBD as two countering protest groups marched through the city.

item.title: Shipping movements disrupted as climate change protesters block coal ships from entering Port of Newcastle
item.description: Police arrest 141 people in Newcastle Harbour for alleged marine-related offences during an anti-fossil fuel protest that began on Thursday.

item.title: Violent explosion during St Marys fire described as 'once in a career type of experience'
item.description: The inferno-like fire broke out at Kurrajong Street in North St Marys overnight, generating immense heat and a huge eruption that spewed a fireball more than 100 metres up into the sky.

item.description: Alternative arrangements are being made for hundreds of students at Deniliquin High School after a fire tore through two buildings containing a library and classrooms.

item.description: David Puig joins legendary countryman Seve Ballesteros as an Australian PGA champion after emerging from a congested field at Royal Queensland Golf Club in Brisbane.

item.title: Chaz Mostert wins maiden Supercars title in Adelaide
item.description: Chaz Mostert breaks through for a maiden Supercars championship after rival Broc Feeney spins out on the opening lap at the Adelaide grand final.

item.description: Firefighters are defending properties in the outer Geraldton suburbs of Waggrakine and Moresby as a bushfire burned close to homes on Sunday afternoon.

item.title: Port Lincoln sailor feared dead in Mozambique Channel off coast of Africa
item.description: The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade says it is providing consular assistance to the family of an Australian missing in the Mozambique Channel off the coast of Africa.
